question: 田畑
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>rice paddy</kanji> <kanji>field</kanji>. You'd think this would refer only to a rice field, but it actually refers to other types of fields too, making this word simply <vocabulary>field</vocabulary>. I guess that shows how important rice is, because if a field isn't growing rice, it ain't no field o' mine.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings come from what you learned with the kanji. <ja>畑</ja> uses the shorter <ja>はた</ja> reading that you learned.
